type1.text: Did you provide a specific example situation relevant to the role?
Did you objectively describe the situation without judgmental statements?
Did you clearly explain the context, challenges, and objectives involved?
Did you detail the specific steps, analysis, or approach you took?
Did you discuss what you learned or would do differently next time?
Did you demonstrate problem-solving abilities through your thought process?
Did you showcase self-awareness by acknowledging mistakes or areas for improvement?
Did you highlight collaboration and working effectively with others?
Did you display skills in communicating complex information clearly?
Did you convey a passion for leveraging data to drive impact?

type2.text: How well did you structure your responses using the STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)?
options: Responses were disorganized without a clear structure
Used the STAR format inconsistently or incompletely
Followed STAR format but some points were unclear or missing details
Clearly followed STAR format with appropriate situation details
Perfectly structured using STAR with concise and impactful details

type2.text: How effectively did you demonstrate analytical and critical thinking abilities?
options: Examples did not showcase any analytical or structured thinking
Mentioned analysis but actions were limited or lacked depth
Displayed basic analytical skills in straightforward situations
Highlighted strong analytical abilities in tackling complex problems
Provided compelling examples of leveraging advanced analytical techniques

type2.text: How well did you handle ambiguity, changing priorities, or project constraints?
options: Examples only involved low/no ambiguity or constraint situations
Showed struggles with ambiguity or constraints without clear approaches
Demonstrated basic approaches like making assumptions in ambiguous cases
Showcased ability to adapt plans and prioritize in changing environments
Clearly articulated structured frameworks for thriving amidst ambiguity

type2.text: How strongly did your examples highlight customer/client focus and business impact?
options: Examples did not mention any customer/client or business perspectives
Mentioned customers/clients but actions were analytically-focused
Displayed some consideration of customer needs and business impact
Clearly made customer/client needs and business objectives the key priority
Provided powerful examples directly linking analysis to customer/business value

type2.text: How persuasively did you demonstrate skills in leadership, influence, and communication?
options: Examples were purely individual contributor roles without leadership aspects
Mentioned team or stakeholder interactions but did not elaborate on influence
Displayed some leadership through guiding team tasks or information sharing
Clearly articulated strategies for motivating teams and influencing stakeholders
Provided comprehensive examples showcasing dynamic leadership and communication
